01/2003 to 01/2011
AVP, JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. 2.35T asset bank) Aggressively prospected and fostered new business relationships.
Focus was on small businesses from $250k sole proprietors to $20MM C-corporations.
Underwrote and funded many small business loans.
Managed an annual $260k+, net revenue producing portfolio- approximately $22MM in size.
Created new communication paths across division lines which integrated retail, mortgage, and small business.
This was the first time this had been done in our division.
Its successful effort brought much needed trust between banking segments, created deeper client relationships, and aligned corporate goals.
Built recommendations and provided small businesses with cash flow modeling and treasury solutions.
Sold and underwrote Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, FHA, VA and RHA mortgage loans.
Built and executed new customer service initiatives which helped us achieve a #12 ranking in the country for client retention among mortgage officers.
Worked alongside area and regional managers in the development and implementation of incentive models that assimilate mortgage and retail bankers to one another.
Trained, coached, implemented, and initiated incentives which helped grow the mortgage production level from <$8mm>
to over $22MM+/yr.
Led Chase Bank by achieving the prominent recognition of being one of the top 350 consumer loan producing bankers in the nation.
Implemented new needs-based cross-selling techniques and retention strategies to significantly grow sales results across our retail team.
Sold clients personal deposit accounts, credit cards, home equities, mutual funds, life insurance, fixed annuities, consumer loans.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Data Quality & Analytics AVP 

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Other

Description:
The Data Quality & Analytics AVP will be part of the team supporting the bank-wide data management programs, especially on data/business analytics, and improving business results through the usage of data across the organization.
Job ResponsibilitiesInclude but are not limited to
Data AnalyticsDomain Understanding: Work closely with business teams to understand their specific domains and data requirements. Formulate data needs based on business context and objectives.Data Source Identification and Quality Analysis: Identify relevant data sources and conduct data quality assessments, data issue root cause analysis, and propose remediation solutions.Automated Data Scraping and Standardization: Develop automated processes for data extraction and scraping (with IT support). Cleanse and standardize data to ensure accuracy and consistency.Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and anomalies. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders.BI Reports Development: Utilize Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Qlik Sense) to build dashboards with visualizations to monitor performance and other business purposes.Presentation and Communication: Create compelling presentation decks using tools like PowerPoint to present data analysis results to business leaders and management effectively.
Data Analytics Education, Communications and GuidanceAdvocacy and Education:Promote data analytics practices and technology adoption within the organization.Training Development: Contribute to the development and execution of educational programs on data analytics.
Job RequirementsBachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferredA minimum of 2 years of experience in the Financial Services Industry focusing on data and at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analytics related, Content-centric/data-centric roles requiredAt least 3 years of experience in SQL and Business Intelligence / Data Visualization tools requiredProficiency in SQL (e.g., dynamic SQL, stored procedures, process automation), Statistical Packages (e.g., Python) for analyzing datasets, Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Qlik Sense，Tableau, Power BI) for visualization is a mustStrong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy is neededExcellent communication and presentation abilities requiredKnowledge of regulatory/compliance and risk management requiredKnowledge and experience in project management required
The salary range for the AVP position is $65,000-$150,000 per year. Actual salary is commensurate with candidate’s relevant years of experience, skillset, education and other qualifications.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
